skill.name: scientific-slides
skill.description: Build slide decks and presentations for research talks. Use this for making PowerPoint slides, conference presentations, seminar talks, research presentations, thesis defense slides, or any scientific talk. Provides slide structure, design templates, timing guidance, and visual validation. Works with PowerPoint and LaTeX Beamer.
skill.summary: Create professional scientific presentations with templates, structure guidance, and AI-powered slide generation
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: All 1243 static findings are false positives. Scanner incorrectly flagged LaTeX commands as crypto, markdown code blocks as shell commands, hex color codes as C2 infrastructure, and standard API patterns as credential exfiltration. This is a legitimate presentation tool with no malicious behavior.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] obfuscation: [HEURISTIC] DANGEROUS COMBINATION: Code execution + Network + Credential access
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: This pattern is standard API usage: environment variable access for OPENROUTER_API_KEY, followed by HTTP requests to generate slides. No exfiltration - calls go to legitimate OpenRouter AI API for image generation.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] sensitive: Windows SAM database at references/talk_types_guide.md:588
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Context shows 'TAM, SAM, SOM' - business metrics (Total/Serviceable Addressable Market) for industry pitches. Not Windows Security Account Manager.
All instances are hex color codes #2C2C2C (charcoal color) used in design system definitions. Not command-and-control infrastructure.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at assets/beamer_template_*.tex (multiple lines)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Scanner misidentifies LaTeX commands like \title{}, \author{}, \usepackage{} as cryptographic functions. LaTeX document markup is not executable code with crypto operations.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md, assets/*.md, references/*.md (400+ locations)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Scanner flags markdown code block delimiters (```) as shell backticks. These are documentation code examples, not executable commands.
Scanner flags 'import base64' as weak crypto. base64 is encoding, not cryptography. No actual weak cryptographic algorithms found.
Standard API key management pattern - reads OPENROUTER_API_KEY from environment variables. Secrets never logged or exfiltrated, only used for legitimate API calls.
URLs are legitimate API endpoints for OpenRouter (openrouter.ai). Not suspicious destinations.
Standard temporary file operations for slide image generation. No path traversal or unsafe operations.

content.value_statement: Scientific presentations require professional design and clear structure. This skill provides templates, design guidance, and AI-powered slide generation for conferences, seminars, thesis defenses, and research talks.
actual_capabilities: Generate complete slide images using AI for PDF presentations
Create LaTeX Beamer templates for academic conferences
Design PowerPoint slides with professional color schemes
Apply research-backed visual principles to presentations
limitations: Does not record or present slides - only generates content
Requires external API key for AI slide generation
Does not provide voice or delivery coaching
Does not integrate with live presentation software

use_cases.title: Conference Presentations
use_cases.description: Create polished slides for academic conferences with proper citations and visual impact.

use_cases.title: Thesis Defense Slides
use_cases.description: Build compelling defense presentations with structured narrative and professional design.

use_cases.title: Seminar and Tutorial Talks
use_cases.description: Design engaging educational presentations with clear visual hierarchy.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slide about [topic] with title '[slide title]', key points: [bullet points], visual style: [color scheme and design description]

prompt_templates.title: With Reference
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate slide based on existing visual
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slide about [concept] that complements this figure [attach image]. Match the color scheme: [description]

prompt_templates.title: Full Presentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate [N] slides for a presentation on [topic]. Include: title slide, [number] content slides, [number] conclusion slide. Style: [color palette, fonts, aesthetic]

prompt_templates.title: Research Slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a research slide about [finding] citing [source]. Include methodology, results, and implications. Visual: [description]. Citations: [reference details]

output_examples.input: Create a title slide for a machine learning conference talk
output: Title: Machine Learning: From Theory to Practice
Visual: Abstract neural network background with blue and gold accents

best_practices: Define consistent formatting (colors, fonts, style) at the start and reference it for every slide
Use the --attach flag to maintain visual consistency when generating multiple slides
Include citations directly in prompts when referencing research findings
anti_patterns: Using different color schemes or fonts across slides in the same presentation
Generating slides without a clear narrative structure or logical flow
Creating text-heavy slides that just repeat what you will say verbally

faq.question: What formats can I generate slides in?
faq.answer: PDF slides (full images) and PowerPoint slides with embedded visuals.

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: Yes, an OpenRouter API key is required for AI-powered slide generation.

faq.question: Can I use my own templates?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use LaTeX Beamer templates or design your own PowerPoint master slides.

faq.question: How do I maintain visual consistency?
faq.answer: Define your design system upfront and use the --attach flag to reference previous slides.

faq.question: What slide sizes are supported?
faq.answer: Standard 16:9 aspect ratio for conferences and 4:3 for legacy projectors.

faq.question: Can I add my own images?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --attach flag to include reference images that Nano Banana Pro will consider.
